alert.note: Alert for Anson; Montgomery; Richmond; Stanly (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 23 at 7:34PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Anson, Montgomery, western Richmond and southeastern Stanly Counties through 830 PM EDT... At 734 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Unionville to 7 miles west of Bishopville. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Albemarle, Rockingham, Wadesboro, Troy, Biscoe, Ansonville, Polkton, Norwood, Badin and Oakboro. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Doppler radar has indicated weak rotation with this storm. If the storm intensifies and rotation strengthens, a warning may need to be issued.
